Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory946.jpg'}
{3: 'After an electronic voice announces, "Access Granted," the control room\'s door slowly opens, revealing a familiar figure in dark crimson standing at the entrance.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Phew... Good thing it's you and not Hanying.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: "I told you she's not a threat.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'She pauses, seemingly noticing something.'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: "You've... modified yourself again?", 4: '2'}
{3: 'The young man before her has replaced his arm and lower leg with mechanical parts, making him look increasingly like a mechanoid.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'Sigh... I had no choice but to do this after being gravely wounded in that attack by the human rebels.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "As you know, I've always admired mechanoids. It's not against that aspiration to increase the number of mechanized parts in me.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'After pacing around the central console, Aleksei turns to look at Veronica.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Veronica', 3: "I'll make them pay for this.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'But... that\'s not what concerns me. I\'m worried that those humans will only escalate things further, eventually threatening our "dream."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "They didn't just attack me—they brought reinforcements from Babylonia, and even turned your own kin against you...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As his tone grows more intense, the female mechanoid gets visibly more angry.'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: 'Hanying, SDC-39... Are all Hanged Men this blindly devoted to humanity?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'Obviously... Humans always have such an irresistible pull on mechanoids.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: '...Incomprehensible.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: 'After pointlessly sacrificing so much for humans, he died at the hands of those he showed kindness to.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: 'SDC-39... He was so naive, believing that the bridge would lead to heaven, and he even wanted to go with the humans...!', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Sharp red light coils around her spear as she slams the weapon down beside her.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Ah... Careful now. It's very hard to repair the equipment here if it gets damaged...", 4: '1'}
{3: "Keeping clear of Veronica's spear, he approaches the central console from the other side."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'Yes... SDC-39, our friend... What a pity.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "But there's still time, Veronica. We can still stop Hanying... and all the other mechanoids.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'If we successfully drag humanity into the abyss, these tragedies will never happen again.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "This is the bridge's final charge, Veronica. Babylonia is within our grasp now.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'He steps aside, revealing the charge button on the screen.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Press it... that's all it takes. Once it finishes charging, we'll be one step closer to our new world.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'But Veronica does not press the button right away.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Veronica', 3: "Aleksei, you've been acting strange lately.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: "Weren't you always friendly to humans? Improving their conditions, speaking up for them...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She turns a suspicious gaze toward Aleksei.'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: "I must have told you before—no matter how much you mechanize yourself, you can never become a mechanoid. You don't have a mechanoid's core.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: 'Why is a human so eager to destroy his own kind?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Perhaps... I've been hurt by humans one too many times.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'He shows his bullet-riddled mechanical arm and lets out a soft sigh.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'I trusted them. Like you said, I tried to improve their conditions and fight for something better for them, but... what did I get in return?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "I'm tired, Veronica. Besides... isn't building a new world for mechanoids our shared dream?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'A flicker of madness crosses his purple eyes.'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'In this new world, there will be no more capricious humans, no more sanctimonious virus—only a perfect world forged from an ocean of steel!', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'Mechanoids possess stronger bodies, superior computing power, and an unshakeable order. Meanwhile, humans barely survive the torment of the Punishing Virus. Mechanoids should rightfully take their place!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'Above all, there will be no more lies in that world.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'As his madness subsides, an inexplicable glint returns to his eyes.'}

{2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Veronica, I've witnessed the rise and fall of the mechanoids in Aerospace City as a machinist. Today, you may finally lead them toward a future that truly belongs to your kind...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'I just want to make sure that I always witness the final scene.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'He looks up, his expression heavy with sorrow, yet not a single tear falls from his eyes.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Veronica', 3: "I still can't understand your kind, after all.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She frowns slightly before relaxing her face in resignation.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Veronica', 3: "Even if the final charging phase has begun, Bifrost can't be activated immediately. I'll remain in the control room and ensure no one interferes with it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Veronica', 3: "But the situation in the city remains tense. The resistance won't take a day off just because of this—you understand what I mean?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: "Of course. I'll return to command the mechanoids to suppress the resistance.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Despite what he has said, Aleksei remains rooted to the spot.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Veronica', 3: '...Are you that eager to see me press the button right in front of you?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aleksei', 3: 'Ah, I just... remembered something else.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Not wanting to arouse further suspicion from Veronica, Aleksei hastily excuses himself and hurries out of the control room.'}
